ecoregion_eastern-himalayan-broadleaf-an.title: Eastern Himalayan Broadleaf and Conifer Forests

hotspot_chaco.explanation: Large tracts of rainforest have been cleared for argiculture in Paraguay
hotspot_chaco.title: Chaco

hotspot_alaska.explanation: Summer fires in Alaska annually cause damage to forests. The fires have become more intense in recent years due to drier and warmer weather.
hotspot_alaska.title: Alaska

ecoregion_peninsular-malaysia-lowland-an.title: Peninsular Malaysia Lowland and Montane Forests

hotspot_roanoke.explanation: Commercial tree cropping results in periodic forest change across the southeastern United States, seen here near Roanoke Rapids, NC. The tree belt extends from VA to TX, and its cultivation affects the region's habitat, hydrology, and carbon.
hotspot_roanoke.title: Roanoke

hotspot_philippines.explanation: Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines was one of strongest tropical cyclones to make landfall in recorded history ? the forest layers show the track clearly as landfall is made close to Tacloban City and proceeded east to west. Scientific evidence shows extreme weather events being linked to climate change. Evidence of climate change as a driver of increased cyclone strength is a contested issue.
hotspot_philippines.title: Philippines

hotspot_cote-divoire.explanation: Ivory Coast had two civil wars in 2002 and 2007, leading to general loss of governance and the clearing of a number of protected areas. This zoom shows only Tai National Forest, a World Heritage site, as having escaped the chaos.
hotspot_cote-divoire.title: Ivory Coast

hotspot_siberia.explanation: The Siberian larch forests of Yakutia, Russia, are very prone to fire during spring to early summer, when the ground has dried out after winter snow melt. Most of these fires are deliberately set and spread uncontrolled.
hotspot_siberia.title: Siberia

hotspot_colorado.explanation: Mountain pine beetles have destroyed wide areas of lodgepole pine forest in North America. Here you can see damage in the Colorado Rockies. Unseasonably warm weather due to climate change seems to be abetting the damage.
hotspot_colorado.title: Colorado

hotspot_alberta.explanation: Deforestation is part of the process for extracting oil from the tar sands in Alberta.
hotspot_alberta.title: Alberta

ecoregion_russian-far-east-broadleaf-and.title: Russian Far East Broadleaf and Mixed Forests

hotspot_sweden.explanation: The powerful storm Gudrun hit Sweden during the winter of 2005. Its hurricane-force winds knocked over 110% of the country's normal annual forestry harvest.
hotspot_sweden.title: Sweden

hotspot_tuscaloosa.explanation: A 2011 tornado outbreak caused forest damage along the route from Tuscaloosa to Birmingham. Land clearing hundreds of miles south in Central America may have intensified the outbreak.
hotspot_tuscaloosa.title: Tuscaloosa

hotspot_congo.explanation: Conflict in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has led to internal migrations of populations into intact forests. Congo is the deadliest conflict since WWII and a stateless condition exists with people fending for themselves. In the case of the Maringa landscape, many people have sought to be isolated from the wider world to reduce risk of exposure to conflict.
hotspot_congo.title: Congo

hotspot_borneo.explanation: The Malaysia state of Sarawak has logged almost the entirety of its side of Borneo. Note the stark contrast across the international border with Indonesia in the east.
hotspot_borneo.title: Borneo

hotspot_pacnorthwest.explanation: In the face of commercial Pacific Northwest logging, the importance of protected areas such as Olympic National Park is clearly visible. With the loss/extent/gain (R/G/B) layer enabled, you can see regrowth in blue due to logging bans and the attempt to protect spotted owl habitat.
hotspot_pacnorthwest.title: Pacific Northwest

hotspot_zambia.explanation: Zambia?s Copper Belt was revitalized by Chinese investment and economic growth. However, the engagement has not been without conflict. Workers? rights have been an issue, with Chinese management and Zambian coal miners clashing. Now, slowing, Zambia?s economy suffers.
hotspot_zambia.title: Zambia

ecoregion_lord-howe-and-norfolk-island-f.title: Lord Howe and Norfolk Island Forests

hotspot_peru.explanation: Artisanal gold mining in southern Peru requires clearing parts of the forest.
hotspot_peru.title: Southern Peru

ecoregion_sierra-madre-oriental-and-occi.title: Sierra Madre Oriental and Occidental Pine-Oak Fo

hotspot_chernobyl.explanation: Some of our most impressive reserves for wildlife are dangerous places for humans, whether the Demilitarized Zone between the two Koreas or here, the radioactive exclusion zone of Chernobyl.
hotspot_chernobyl.title: Chernobyl

hotspot_amazon.explanation: The Brazilian rainforest has long been a target for deforestation. The large amount of yellow reflects the slowdown in clearing as a result of legal and economic interventions.
hotspot_amazon.title: Amazon rainforest

ecoregion_valdivian-temperate-rain-fores.title: Valdivian Temperate Rain Forests / Juan Fernánde

ecoregion_sumatran-islands-lowland-and-m.title: Sumatran Islands Lowland and Montane Forests

hotspot_indonesia.explanation: Palm cultivation is driving deforestation in Indonesia, threatening the habitats of orangutans and other charismatic species.
hotspot_indonesia.title: Indonesia

hotspot_mesoamerica.explanation: Argiculture, especially the creation of pasture for cattle, has caused deforestation and habitat fragmentation in Mesoamerica.
hotspot_mesoamerica.title: Mesoamerica

hotspot_cambodia.explanation: Rubber harvesting drives much of the deforestation in Cambodia, which is occurring even in protected regions.
hotspot_cambodia.title: Cambodia

hotspot_sichuan.explanation: The 2008 Sichuan earthquake was one of the most destructive earthquakes on record. Landslides carried forests off of mountain sides.
hotspot_sichuan.title: Sichuan
